titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Luis Howell-Rivero was a Cuban biologist, anthropologist and member of the Ichthyology Department at Havana University. In the 1920's and 30's he identified numerous new species of animals, especially fish, in Cuba and in other areas of the Caribbean. He helped establish institutions for the study of biology and botany throughout Central and South America and later in life became an expert for UNESCO.

scopecontent.p: Twenty three hand-colored photographs of Cuban eels, from the collection of Luis Howell Rivero. Each photograph is labeled with the family, species, and genus. The collection also includes two black and white photographs of eels.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
